title: National Government Services Portal
description: National Government Services Portal of India provides single window access to services offered by the various Indian Government entities. This Portal is an initiative under the India Portal Project and has been designed and developed by National Informatics Centre (NIC), Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology, Government of India.

items.title: Register Senior Citizen for the Safety by Delhi Police, Delhi
items.description: The Delhi Police Senior Citizen Registration portal is designed to ensure the safety and well-being of elderly residents in the city. Through this platform, senior citizens can register their details with local police stations to receive regular assistance, protection, and support in emergencies. The initiative fosters a sense of security and care by enabling direct communication between seniors and the police. It reflects Delhi Police’s commitment to community policing, promoting dignity, safety,...

items.title: Social Security and Old Age Welfare, Delhi
items.description: The Social Security and Old Age Welfare portal of the Delhi Government provides details and access to various welfare schemes supporting senior citizens, widows, differently-abled individuals, and economically weaker groups. Citizens can apply for pensions, financial aid, and social assistance programs designed to ensure dignity and security in old age. The platform simplifies applications and provides transparent updates on welfare benefits. It represents Delhi’s commitment to inclusive governance,...

items.title: Schemes of Dr. Ambedkar Foundation
items.description: This official page provides detailed information on various welfare and development schemes initiated by the Dr. Ambedkar Foundation, under the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. It highlights programs aimed at promoting social equality, education, skill development, and empowerment of marginalized communities. Visitors can explore eligibility criteria, objectives, and application processes for multiple schemes dedicated to fulfilling the vision of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar in uplifting disadvantaged...

items.title: Apply for Postal Life Insurance by India Post
items.description: The India Post portal allows citizens to apply online for Postal Life Insurance (PLI) services. Offering affordable insurance plans, PLI is designed to provide financial security to individuals and families. Through this platform, users can explore policies, apply digitally, and manage existing insurance accounts with ease. The portal simplifies the enrollment process, reduces paperwork, and provides secure access to policy details. It reflects India Post’s commitment to extending reliable insurance...

items.title: Mukh Mantri Punjab Cancer Raahat Kosh Scheme, Punjab
items.description: Mukh Mantri Punjab Cancer Raahat Kosh Scheme was initiated by the Government of Punjab with a view to provide financial assistance to Punjab resident cancer patients. Financial assistance of up to Rs.1.50 Lakhs (One lakh fifty thousand) is provided for the treatment to each cancer patient except Government employees, ESI employees and their dependents, those patients who have any kind of facility of medical reimbursement or any other persons who have opted for Health Insurance by Insurance companies.

items.title: Financial Assistance Schemes of Old Age Assistance, Delhi
items.description: Financial Assistance Schemes of Old Age Assistance, Delhi provide monthly support to senior citizens, ensuring financial security in their later years. Beneficiaries aged 60–69 years receive Rs. 2,000 per month, remitted quarterly, through Aadhaar-linked bank accounts under the Aadhaar Payment Bridge System;. Additionally, individuals belonging to SC, ST, or Minority communities are entitled to an extra Rs. 500 per month. Rs. 2,500/- p.m. remitted quarterly for all beneficiaries 70 years and above....

items.title: Apply for Disability Pension/ Widow Pension/ Old Age Pension by e-Labharthi, Bihar
items.description: e-Labharthi is a centralized beneficiary management portal in Bihar for schemes like pensions, scholarships, and free bicycles. It ensures accurate beneficiary identification, improves service delivery, and consolidates information across departments such as Education, SC/ST Welfare, Social Security, and Minority Welfare. Users can track application status and access scheme benefits easily.

items.title: Apply for Disability Certificate/ UDID Card, Punjab
items.description: The UDID (Unique Disability ID) card streamlines access to various benefits for Persons with Disabilities in Punjab. It serves as a single document for identification and verification, eliminating the need to carry multiple documents. The card stores essential disability details and simplifies benefit tracking across village, district, state, and national levels. Applicants can apply online and upload required documents for efficient issuance and nationwide recognition.

items.title: Apply for Dependent Children Pension Scheme, Punjab
items.description: The scheme supports children under 21 years whose parents are deceased, missing, or incapacitated. With an annual family income cap of ₹60,000, the scheme provides monthly financial assistance to ensure the child’s well-being and education. In the absence of the original guardian, a successor or near relative is nominated by the SDM to continue receiving benefits without interruption. This ensures continuous support for vulnerable children in Punjab.

items.title: Apply for Disabled Person Pension Scheme, Punjab
items.description: This scheme offers monthly financial assistance to persons with 80% or more disability, including dwarfs, aged 18 years and above. Beneficiaries receive ₹300 per month, which increases to ₹500 after the age of 80. The initiative ensures financial support and dignity for persons with severe disabilities, helping them meet basic needs and live independently. The pension helps reduce economic dependency and improve the quality of life for eligible individuals in Punjab.

items.title: Apply for Widow Destitute Pension Scheme, Punjab
items.description: The Widow/Destitute Pension Scheme provides financial support to widows, destitute women below 58 years, and unmarried women above 30 years in Punjab. Eligible applicants must have a total annual income not exceeding ₹60,000, including income from business, rent, or interest. The scheme aims to ensure economic stability and social security for women facing hardship due to loss of spouse or prolonged unmarried status. Applicants can apply online through the official Punjab Connect portal.

items.title: Apply for Old Age Pension Scheme, Punjab
items.description: This scheme provides financial support to elderly citizens in Punjab women aged 58 years and above and men aged 65 years and above. Eligible individuals must have a monthly income not exceeding ₹2000 (single) or ₹3000 (couple), with land ownership limits also applying. The pension aims to ensure social security and dignity for the elderly who lack sufficient means of support. Applications can be submitted online through the dedicated portal for quick and transparent processing.

items.title: Apply for State Mahila Sadan and Nari Niketan Scheme, Rajasthan
items.description: This scheme aims to empower widows, destitute, and economically weaker women by providing shelter, safety, and livelihood opportunities. Through Mahila Sadans and Nari Niketans, the Rajasthan Government ensures holistic support—ranging from education and vocational training to emotional and social rehabilitation—helping women become self-reliant and lead dignified lives.

items.title: Apply for Collaboration and Gift Scheme, Rajasthan
items.description: The Collaboration and Gift Scheme is an integration of the Sahayog Yojana and the Assistance Scheme for the marriage of daughters of widowed women. Run by the Rajasthan Government, it provides financial support to ensure dignified marriages and promote social welfare. The initiative aims to support economically weaker sections and widowed women through marriage-related assistance.

items.title: Apply for Pannadhay Jeevan Amrit Yojana, Rajasthan
items.description: Pannadhay Jeevan Amrit Yojana provides life and accident insurance coverage for citizens in Rajasthan. Individuals aged 18–50 years are included under Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana and Suraksha Bima Yojana, while those aged 51–59 years continue to be insured under Panna Dhai Jeevan Amrit Yojana. The scheme aims to provide financial security to families after the death or disability of the breadwinner.

items.title: Apply for Chief Minister Special Disabled Person Samman Pension Scheme, Rajasthan
items.description: Specially abled person of any age who is suffering from any one or more disabilities (40 percent and more disability) like blindness, low vision, locomotor disability, leprosy cured, hearing loss, mental retardation, mental illness, Should be naturally suffering from eunuchism (in case of adult person whose height is less than 3 feet 6 inches and should have a certificate issued by authorized medical officer) and should be naturally suffering from eunuchism, Who is a native of Rajasthan and is living...

items.title: Apply for Chief Minister Old Age Samman Pension Scheme, Rajasthan
items.description: This scheme offers financial support to elderly citizens of Rajasthan — women aged 55 years and above and men aged 58 years and above — who have no regular income. Those belonging to BPL, Antyodaya, Aastha cardholder families, or Sahariya, Kathodi, and Khairwa castes are exempted from income criteria. The aim is to ensure economic security and respect for the elderly population.

items.title: Apply for Indira Gandhi National Disabled Pension Scheme, Rajasthan
items.description: The Indira Gandhi National Disabled Pension Scheme, approved by the Rajasthan Government, provides financial assistance to persons aged 18 or above from BPL families suffering from multiple or severe disabilities. Eligible beneficiaries receive monthly pensions to support their livelihood, helping them live with dignity and security. Applications can be made through the Social Justice and Empowerment Department's official portal.

items.title: Apply for Chief Minister Ekalnaari Samman Pension Scheme, Rajasthan
items.description: The Chief Minister Ekalnaari Samman Pension Scheme supports widowed, abandoned, or divorced women aged 18 and above who are Rajasthan natives. Women without a regular income and an annual income below ₹48,000 are eligible for a monthly pension, ensuring financial assistance and promoting the welfare of single women in the state.

items.title: Apply for Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme, Rajasthan
items.description: The Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme provides financial support to elderly citizens aged 60 and above from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families in Rajasthan. Initiated by the Central Government and implemented by the Rajasthan Government, the scheme ensures a monthly pension, promoting social security and dignity for senior citizens.
